sentences.sContent: There were tears in her eyes as she listened to the story.
sentences.sCn: 她听故事时眼里噙着泪水。

sentences.sContent: A surgeon needs a good eye and a steady hand.
sentences.sCn: 做外科医生眼要准，手要稳。

sentences.sContent: ...New research shows that dogs limit their eye contact with angry humans...
...The team found that exercise reduced the speed of rapid eye movements by about 8%...
...Nearby cameras tracked the dogs' eye movements...
...One should enter it vaguely, and allow what is there freely to attract and influence the eye to walk the rounds of the bookshops...
...Tears protect the eye by keeping it moist...
...pale creatures who can't make eye contact and has a girlfriend who lives only in the virtual world...
...it's that the authors don't spend enough time applying a critical eye to the role of Internet businesses in these sweeping changes...
...What do we learn about eye transplanting from the talk...
...Only certain parts of the eye can be replaced...
...There are many commonly held beliefs about eye glasses and eyesight that are not proven facts...

synos.tran: [解剖]眼睛；视力；眼光；见解，观点

phrases.pCn: adv. 从表面上看来；公然
对…很有兴趣，对…有很深的爱好；对…有敏锐的鉴赏力；能欣赏；能判断
目不转睛；众目睽睽；聚精会神地看
群众的眼睛；社会的注意
广为人知的；受公众瞩目的
v. 照看；留意；密切注视
黑眼圈；被打得发青的眼圈；丑事
[澳大利亚、新西兰口语]全力以赴，竭尽全力
不费劲地随便一看，望一眼

words.tran: 看；注视；考虑（eye的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: one of the two parts of the body that you use to see with
